alert.note: Alert for Cortland; Onondaga; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Tompkins; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:05PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Seneca, northern Schuyler, southeastern Yates, Cayuga, northwestern Cortland, southwestern Onondaga and northern Tompkins Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 905 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cascade, or 14 miles south of Auburn, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Hector, Owasco, Starkey, Lansing, Homer, Otisco, Groton and Covert. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 13 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central New York.

area.areaDesc: Cortland; Onondaga; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Tompkins; Yates
